member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteEx.OnInPlaceActivateEx
member.summary: Called by the embedded object to determine whether it needs to redraw itself upon activation.
member.param: A pointer to a variable that receives the current redraw status. The status is TRUE if the object need not redraw itself upon activation and FALSE otherwise. Windowless objects usually do not need the value returned by this parameter and may pass a NULL pointer to save the container the burden of computing this value.
Indicates whether the object is activated as a windowless object. This parameter takes values from the enumeration. See for more information on windowless objects.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK if the container allows the in-place activation. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteEx.OnInPlaceDeactivateEx
member.summary: Notifies the container if the object needs to be redrawn upon deactivation.
member.param: If TRUE, the container need not redraw the object after completing the deactivation; if FALSE the object must be redrawn after deactivation.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

member.name: IOleInPlaceSiteEx.RequestUIActivate
member.summary: Notifies the container that the object is about to enter the UI-active state.

returns.para: This method returns S_OK if the object can continue the activation process and call . Other possible return values include the following.

listheader.description: The object cannot enter the UI-active state. The object must call so the container can perform its the necessary processing to restore the focus.

summary.para: Provides an additional set of activation and deactivation notification methods that enable an object to avoid unnecessary flashing on the screen when the object is activated and deactivated.

When an object is activated, it does not know if its visual display is already correct. When the object is deactivated, the container does not know if the visual display is correct. To avoid a redraw and the associated screen flicker in both cases, the container can provide this extension to .
